text: Psalm 22
Suffering and Waiting for Deliverance

For the \add music\add* director; according to The Doe of the Dawn. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 22 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
My God, my God why have you forsaken me?
\add Why are you\add* far from helping me, \add far from\add* the words of my groaning?
O my God, I call by day and you do not answer,
and \add by\add* night but I have no rest.\f + \fr 22:2 \ft Or “I am not silent” \f*
Yet you \add are\add* holy,
enthroned on the praises of Israel.
Our ancestors\f + \fr 22:4 \ft Or “fathers” \f* trusted you;
they trusted and you delivered them.
They cried to you and were saved;
they trusted you and were not ashamed.
But I \add am\add* a worm and not a man,
scorned by humankind and despised by people.
All \add who\add* see me mock me.
They open wide \add their\add* lips;
they shake \add the\add* head, \add saying\add*:
“⸤He trusts Yahweh⸥.\f + \fr 22:8 \ft Literally “Commit to Yahweh” \f* Let him rescue him.
Let him deliver him because he delights in him.”
Yet \add you\add* took me from \add the\add* belly;
you made me trust \add while\add* on my mother’s breasts.
On you I was cast from \add the\add* womb.
From my mother’s belly you \add have been\add* my God.
Do not be far from me
because trouble \add is\add* near;
because there is no helper.
Many bulls have encircled me;
mighty \add bulls\add* of Bashan have surrounded me.
They open their mouth against me
\add like\add* a lion tearing and roaring.
I am poured out like water,
and all my bones are out of joint.
My heart is like wax;
it is melted ⸤within me⸥.\f + \fr 22:14 \ft Literally “in the midst of my intestines” \f*
My strength is dry like a potsherd,
and my tongue is sticking \add to\add* my jaws;
and you have placed me in \add the\add* dust of death.
Because dogs have surrounded me;
a gang of evildoers has encircled me.

Like the lion\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Or “they gouge out” or “they bind.” Not the same word for “lion” found in vv. \xt 14 \ft (13), 22(21). The Hebrew text presents such problems that any interpretation must be lightly held. \f* \add they are at\add* my hands and my feet.
I can count all my bones;
they gaze, they look at me.
They divide my garments among them,
and for my clothing they cast lots.\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Hebrew “lot” \f*
But you, O Yahweh, do not remain distant.
O my help, hasten to help me.
Rescue my life from \add the\add* sword,
my only \add life\add* from \add the\add* power of \add the\add* dogs.\f + \fr 22:20 \ft Hebrew “dog” \f*
Save me from \add the\add* mouth of \add the\add* lion,
and from \add the\add* horns of \add the\add* wild oxen answer me.
I will tell your name to my brothers;
inside \add the\add* assembly I will praise you.
You who revere Yahweh, praise him!
Glorify him, all \add you\add* seed of Jacob,
and be in awe of him, all \add you\add* seed of Israel,
because he has not despised nor abhorred \add the\add* affliction of \add the\add* afflicted,
and has not hid his face from him;
but he listened to him when he cried for help.
From you \add is\add* my praise.
In \add the\add* great assembly,
I will pay my vows before those who revere him.
\add The\add* afflicted will eat and will be satisfied.
Those who seek him will praise Yahweh.
May your\f + \fr 22:26 \ft Plural \f* heart live forever.
All \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* earth
will remember and turn to Yahweh.
All \add the\add* families of \add the\add* nations
will worship before you.
Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh,
and \add he\add* rules over the nations.
All \add the\add* ⸤healthy ones⸥\f + \fr 22:29 \ft Or “prosperous”; Literally “fat ones” \f* of \add the\add* earth will eat and worship.
Before him all \add of\add* those descending \add into the\add* dust will kneel,
even he \add who\add* cannot keep his soul alive.
Descendants\f + \fr 22:30 \ft Hebrew “Descendant” \f* will serve him.
Regarding the Lord, it will be told to the \add next\add* generation.
They will come and tell his saving\f + \fr 22:31 \ft Or “righteousness” \f* \add deeds\add*
to a people \add yet\add* to be born, that he has done \add it\add*.
